color: rgb(0, 0, 0) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: 🎯 Business Goal: Increase conversion via personalization

div.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: 🤔 Are user behavior patterns too complex for simple rules?

div.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;
display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
✅ Use a simple heuristic
or rules-based system.

div.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0) !important; display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p: 📈 Is the task predictive in nature?

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0) !important; display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
⚡ Is real-time responsiveness
required for interventions?

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
🚀 ML is a strong fit.
Proceed with framing.

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: normal; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
📦 Consider an offline
batch prediction model.
